Greetings,

I am working in Eclipse.  I have defined an @After method in th=
e superclass of all my test classes.  When I invoke the tests individually =
through Eclipse, my @After method gets invoked as I expect.

We have writte=
n a program that uses JUnitCore to execute tests.  It runs all the tests as=
 expected, except it does not execute the @After method for each test.

Is =
there something obvious I am missing or something I need to do to get JUnit=
Core to execute the @After routine?

-Sam
